Comment: McDonald’s isn’t a brand that customers rely on for convenience like Amazon or Target. Those brands have cornered the market and make it hard for consumers to boycott. McDonald’s on the other hand has been a dying brand over the last couple decades, and their product is low quality food.  If there’s a McDonalds near by, there’s a good chance there’s 10 other options for consumers, with equal or better quality. McDonalds can’t afford to alienate half of their consumer base, there’s too many other options, and it’s extremely easy to boycott.

Comment: FDA doesn’t inspect raw beef, that’s USDA. But if you cook the beef, then it’s FDA again. While FDA does regulate eggs and the henhouses in which they are laid, they do not regulate the hens within those henhouses laying those FDA-regulated eggs. That’s USDA.  Aside: FDA regulates all fish, *except* catfish (siluriformes).   Our regulatory system around food is *wild*
